question: Some people believe that it is wrong to keep animals in zoos, while others think that zoos are both entertaining and ecologically important. Discuss both views.
text: Objective: To practice planning a meeting using the techniques from the course. You can choose your own meeting agenda.
Agenda: To launch a new health monitoring product specifically catering to consumers over 60 years of age. In addition to the current product portfolio of the company.
1) The first step in the planning process should be to determine the individuals (stakeholders) attending the meeting.
Determine the stakeholders attending the meeting.
2) Then the stakeholders need to understand the data.
Reach out to the stakeholder and get information about their expectation or information needed by them to make a decision.
Address concerns like previous failures with the launch of similar product 10 years ago. Provide details about how it is different and the risk management strategy.
Explain it from the stakeholder perspective. For example, for financial department head provide details on how and how much it is going to bring in additional revenue.
3) Use the decision tree to show all possible decisions that the stakeholders need to take with the consequences, cost and benefits.
Decision tree with conditions on potential revenue growth if the feature was included the next quarter.
4) Explain clearly how it affects the bottom line.
5) Come up with anecdotes and stories to relate to the presentation.
6) Gather details about how the risk will be identified, analyzed and managed.

error_list.error: examined carefully and methodically; broken down for consideration of constituent parts
